context: In Estonian, 'kuula' is the imperative form of the verb 'kulgama' which means 'to listen'. It's used when addressing someone directly to tell them to listen. The related verb 'kulgama' also has the meaning 'to hear', depending on context. In the present tense it would be 'kulge' (listen), and for hearing something you might say 'ma kuulen' (I hear).
